metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20102 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read in dns_validate_dns_response in dns.c was discoveredin HAProxy through 1.8.14. Due to a missing check when validating DNSresponses, remote attackers might be able read the 16 bytes correspondingto an AAAA record from the non-initialized part of the buffer, possiblyaccessing anything that was left on the stack, or even past the end of the8193-byte buffer, depending on the value of accepted_payload_size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.3
vim-haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu0.3').
